DOC.brief_summary: Irisin has been identified as a novel myokine that drives brown-fat-like conversion of white adipose tissue. In this cross-sectional study, the researches investigated whether serum irisin levels are decreased in patients with sarcopenia compared with control subjects with normal muscle mass, and assessed the association between serum irisin levels and various metabolic parameters.
DOC.criteria: 20<age<80 apparently healthy subjects a history of cardiovascular disease diabetes stage 2 hypertension malignancy severe renal or hepatic disease
